questions.text: What time was Sam's flight to California?
questions.explanation:
9:30.

	Sam was going to see Will Bailey.

questions.text: Who said the ten word answer about the economy that the senior staff had been looking for?
questions.explanation:
Ritchie.

	Ritchie answered the question about the economy first and the President called him on the answer.

questions.text: How much money was the bet for that the President made with the staff about Toby?
questions.explanation:
ten dollars.

	Toby got upset when the President couldn't answer an important question correctly. Everyone started laughing during his tirade leading the senior staff to hand over ten dollars to the President, who won the bet that Toby would overreact.

questions.text: Sam referred to Will Bailey as Bill Bailey.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Then he began to do an impression only to be told by Elsie that he was acting out George Bailey and not Bill Bailey.

questions.text: Who did Toby and CJ get to speak to the press after the debate?
questions.explanation:
Albie Duncan.

	Albie Duncan was played by Hal Holbrook. Out of all the senior staff, Albie likes CJ the best and thinks that Josh is Leo's spin boy.

questions.text: Did Sam tell Will he would run in Horton Wilde's place if Will won the election?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Sam: "If I read about this before then I'll deny it and we're through."

Will.

	Sam mentioned to Will that he knew Will ghosted for the California Governor's speech and Josh told Leo he thought the Governor had a new speech writing team.

questions.text: When Josh told everyone to leave the room so the President and Abbey could have some time alone, who stayed in the room?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	Toby: "I just assumed you wanted to include me."

questions.text: For good luck, Abbey cut Jed's tie.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Right before Abbey cut the tie she said, "By the way, I feel bad. I don't think I've done enough to help you prepare for this debate."
